document.discussion_title: Mizuho Reiterates “Buy” Rating for Apple Inc. (AAPL)
document.topic_text: Tweet Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL) ‘s stock had its “buy” rating restated by equities researchers at Mizuho in a report issued on Monday, MarketBeat reports. In other Apple news, Director Arthur D. Levinson sold 2,008 shares of the firm’s stock in a transaction that occurred on Tuesday, February 2nd. The shares were sold at an average price of $95.47, for a total transaction of $191,703.76. Following the sale, the director now directly owns 1,133,283 shares in the company, valued at approximately $108,194,528.01. The sale was disclosed in a filing with the Securities & Exchange Commission, which is accessible through this link . Also, COO Jeffrey E. Williams sold 268,644 shares of the firm’s stock in a transaction that occurred on Tuesday, March 22nd. The stock was sold at an average price of $106.91, for a total transaction of $28,720,730.04. Following the sale, the chief operating officer now owns 528,079 shares in the company, valued at $56,456,925.89. The disclosure for this sale can be found here . Other equities research analysts have also issued research reports about the company. OTR Global lowered Apple in a report on Tuesday, January 12th. Stifel Nicolaus reissued a “buy” rating on shares of Apple in a report on Monday, January 4th. Drexel Hamilton reissued a “buy” rating and issued a $200.00 price objective on shares of Apple in a report on Wednesday, December 30th. FBR & Co. reissued a “buy” rating on shares of Apple in a report on Wednesday, December 30th. Finally, Brean Capital reissued a “buy” rating and issued a $120.00 price objective on shares of Apple in a report on Wednesday, December 30th. Two research analysts have rated the stock with a sell rating, nine have assigned a hold rating, forty-four have issued a buy rating and three have given a strong buy rating to the stock. The stock presently has an average rating of “Buy” and a consensus price target of $136.87. Apple ( NASDAQ:AAPL ) traded down 0.48% during mid-day trading on Monday, reaching $105.17. 18,633,295 shares of the company traded hands. The firm has a market cap of $583.12 billion and a PE ratio of 11.19. Apple has a one year low of $92.00 and a one year high of $134.54. The stock’s 50-day moving average price is $106.77 and its 200-day moving average price is $107.31. Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) last announced its earnings results on Tuesday, January 26th. The iPhone maker reported $3.28 earnings per share (EPS) for the quarter, beating the consensus estimate of $3.23 by $0.05. The business had revenue of $75.87 billion for the quarter, compared to analysts’ expectations of $77.10 billion. During the same period in the prior year, the business earned $3.06 earnings per share. The company’s revenue for the quarter was up 1.7% compared to the same quarter last year. Analysts forecast that Apple will post $9.03 earnings per share for the current fiscal year. Other hedge funds recently made changes to their positions in the company. Park National increased its stake in shares of Apple by 2.4% in the fourth quarter. Park National now owns 217,154 shares of the iPhone maker’s stock valued at $22,858,000 after buying an additional 5,098 shares during the period. EisnerAmper Wealth Management increased its stake in Apple by 3.3% in the fourth quarter. EisnerAmper Wealth Management now owns 12,310 shares of the iPhone maker’s stock worth $1,296,000 after buying an additional 391 shares during the period. Renaissance Investment Group increased its stake in Apple by 2.2% in the fourth quarter. Renaissance Investment Group now owns 75,747 shares of the iPhone maker’s stock worth $7,974,000 after buying an additional 1,643 shares during the period. EQIS Capital Management increased its stake in Apple by 249.3% in the fourth quarter. EQIS Capital Management now owns 54,153 shares of the iPhone maker’s stock worth $5,700,000 after buying an additional 38,648 shares during the period. Finally, Stillwater Investment Management increased its stake in Apple by 0.7% in the fourth quarter. Stillwater Investment Management now owns 49,009 shares of the iPhone maker’s stock worth $5,159,000 after buying an additional 364 shares during the period. Apple Inc ( NASDAQ:AAPL ) designs, manufactures and markets mobile communication and media devices, personal computers, and portable digital music players, and a variety of related software, services, peripherals, networking solutions, and third-party digital content and applications. //www.americanbankingnews.com/2016/04/25/mizuho-reiterates-buy-rating-for-apple-inc-aapl-2/ Apple Inc. Apple Inc.
